projects.title: Calorie Tracker
projects.caption: My First Backbone Project
projects.description: Using BackboneJS, the Nutritionix API, and Firebase I built a calorie tracker with persistent storage
projects.method: In order to complete this project, I read through Addy Osmani's Backbone Fundamentals and experimented with the infamous todoMVC projects. I started the project small. I started by creating a simple list, and added a simple search functionality with hardcoded data. From there I learned how to retrieve API data using Backbone, and finally created a persistent list via Firebase

projects.title: Neighbourhood Map
projects.caption: My First MV* Project
projects.description: Using KnockoutJS, OOJS, build tools such as Gulp, and various Web APIs, I built a simple pub crawl SPA
projects.method: Having no previous knowledge of MVVM concepts, I took a lot of time learning how to create the todoMVC project

projects.title: Asteroids Clone
projects.caption: How I Made Asteroids
projects.description: With a heavy focus on OOJS, I built a HTML5 clone of the classic arcade game, Asteroids
projects.method: Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now

projects.title: Feedreader Testing (Jasmine)
projects.caption: Test-Driven Programming
projects.description: My introductory project into learning how to use Jasmine and Test-Driven Programming
projects.method: Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now Filler Text For Now

projects.title: Website Optimization
projects.caption: Optimize Page Perf
projects.description: Maximizing Web Performance and Optimizing Browser Rendering
projects.method: In this project, I learned about the browser's Critical Rendering Path, deferring or asynchronously loading CSS/JS scripts, how to use build processes such as Gulp/Grunt, and using more efficient Web APIs such as requestAnimationFrame and getElementByClassName vs querySelectorAll.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.caption: My Showcase
projects.description: My first personal website built with BackboneJS
projects.method: Using Backbone to build this project may have been overkill, but Backbone helped reduce a lot of work by automatically rendering each project item, have routing work out of the box, and separate my website's views.

projects.title: Online Resume
projects.caption: Learn About Me!
projects.description: A simple online resume page designed with purely HTML5, CSS3 and jQuery
projects.method: In this project I learned how to write JSON Objects and use jQuery to automatically populate my resume's content. It was a simple project that encouraged me to read through jQuery's documentation and use various JavaScript plugins to achieve the look I wanted. Bootstrap was implemented to achieve a fully responsive look and feel.

projects.title: ReactJS Project
projects.caption: Coming Soon
projects.description: Excited to be learning how to use React!
projects.method: I am currently learning how to use React and my next project will be uploaded soon! I also plan to use ES6 syntax in this project as well
